title: Jimmy Kimmel Presents Oscars-Themed "Mean Tweets"
text:
Sign up for our Newsletters . Daily Edition Jimmy Kimmel Presents Oscars-Themed "Mean Tweets" 8:24 PM PST 2/26/2017 by Jennifer Konerman COMMENTS "I think Jeff Bridges wears pants a lot less than we all think he does." 
Jimmy Kimmel took time out of hosting gig to knock award-winning actors down a peg or two at the Oscars on Sunday. 
Mirroring his Jimmy Kimmel Live! "Mean Tweets" segment, the host presented an Oscars-themed version, featuring Natalie Portman, Felicity Jones, Emma Stone, Ryan Gosling, Lin-Manuel Miranda and more. 
In the brief video, the stars read some of their harshest criticisms online. 
"Oh look at me I'm Ryan Gosling, I have perfect bone structure and kind eyes. Go f— yourself," he read. 
"Are we all just ignoring the fact that Eddie Redmayne and Felicity Jones have the same face?" read the Rogue One actress. 
Samuel L. Jackson read that one Twitter user thinks he "has resting fart face." 
And the most specific tweet? "I think Jeff Bridges wears pants a lot less than we all think he does." 
Lin-Manuel Miranda was mocked for his "'90s sitcom" hair, Emma Stone was poked fun at for looking like a "crack whore in every role she plays" and Robert De Niro fired back at his Twitter troll, saying simply, "f— you." 
The 89th Annual Academy Awards were held at the Dolby Theatre at Hollywood & Highland Center and aired on ABC.
